Athamaru Pirate.description:
Deep in the sea, schools of athamarus—piscine humanoids armed with spears and specialized crossbows—stalk sharks, sea serpents, and giant squid from the backs of their giant moray eel mounts. The first hunters to strike are armed with barbed harpoons that deploy large fans of seaweed, slowing and exhausting their prey. A daring few athamarus use the embedded harpoon as a handle to ride prey for a short time. Once the creature is tired, remaining hunters finish it with longspears. Athamarus developed this hunting tradition to forge skilled warriors and deter potential attackers, partially in response to centuries of oppression and mistreatment from other aquatic cultures.

Athamarus rarely hunt land-dwellers, instead offering to trade their services as guides in exchange for metal and ceramic items they can't build underwater—and for tubers, which they consider earthy delicacies. They render aid to damaged sailing ships and rescue shipwrecked sailors, providing food and guidance.

Athamaru communities—usually villages of 200 individuals or fewer—are matriarchal. The ruler of a given community is also the primary egg-layer, providing each generation with powerful familial bonds. The communities are tight-knit and loyal. Matriarchs are advised and assisted by primal spellcasters and healers.

1elKyf9JIeMq5jrZ.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.
1elKyf9JIeMq5jrZ.name: Fan Bolts

E5px1RlWDeEv4gVY.description: The athamaru pirate can dive underwater, giving them concealment, and reload in the same action.
E5px1RlWDeEv4gVY.name: Diving Reload

F0RaqdAbEfogkX2c.description:
The athamaru pirate prepares their hooked crossbow bolts with carefully woven seaweed. On a successful crossbow Strike, the bolt embeds and the seaweed fan deploys. The target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its swim Speed. A creature can Interact to attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:18] check, removing the bolt on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.seWuw1GMSm3kzCWV]{Effect: Fan Bolt}
F0RaqdAbEfogkX2c.name: Fan Bolt

eBzYlEBFycddJLAk.description: The athamaru pirate designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The athamaru pirate gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the athamaru pirate hits their designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. These effects last until the pirate uses Hunt Prey again.
eBzYlEBFycddJLAk.name: Hunt Prey

zAfIfdV5UBJtB564.description: The athamaru pirate ignores difficult terrain caused by aquatic terrain features.
zAfIfdV5UBJtB564.name: Smooth Swimmer

Athamaru Pirate.name: Athamaru Pirate

A daring few athamarus use the embedded harpoon as a handle to ride prey for a short time. Once the creature is tired, remaining hunters finish it with longspears. Athamarus rarely hunt land-dwellers, instead offering to trade their services as guides in exchange for metal and ceramic items they can't build underwater—and for tubers, which they consider earthy delicacies. Athamaru communities—usually villages of 200 individuals or fewer—are matriarchal. The ruler of a given community is also the primary egg-layer, providing each generation with powerful familial bonds. The communities are tight-knit and loyal. The athamaru swab gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. 7e6GRUALYf5VWbaN.description:
Trigger An enemy damages Bartolo's ally, and both are within 15 feet of him

Effect Bartolo protects his ally and strikes his foe. The ally gains resistance 3 to all damage against the triggering damage. If the foe is within reach, Bartolo makes a melee Strike against it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.DawVHfoPKbPJsz4k]{Effect: Champion's Resistance}
7e6GRUALYf5VWbaN.name: Retributive Strike

aL02VqRkmLi4byoh.description: Bartolo grapples a creature and uses it as a shield, gaining +2 to his AC and the Shield Block reaction while the target is grappled. Use the creature's level plus item bonus to AC (if any) as its Hardness.
aL02VqRkmLi4byoh.name: Living Shield

7e6GRUALYf5VWbaN.description:
Trigger An enemy damages Bartolo's ally, and both are within 15 feet of him

Effect Bartolo protects his ally and strikes his foe The ally gains resistance 5 to all damage against the triggering damage If the foe is within reach, Bartolo makes a melee Strike against it

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.DawVHfoPKbPJsz4k]{Effect: Champion's Resistance}
7e6GRUALYf5VWbaN.name: Retributive Strike

aL02VqRkmLi4byoh.description: Bartolo grapples a creature and uses it as a shield, gaining +2 to his AC and the Shield Block reaction while the target is grappled. Use the creature's level plus item bonus to AC (if any) as its Hardness.
aL02VqRkmLi4byoh.name: Living Shield

Bubbling Pile of Orts.description: A rift to Hell crackles with unstable energy from the broken summoning circle as a squirming mass of fiends struggles to emerge A blood mist projection of a Hellknight angrily commands them.
Bubbling Pile of Orts.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:19], @Check[nature|dc:19], @Check[occultism|dc:19], or @Check[religion|dc:19] (2 actions) (trained) while within 15 feet to weaken the rift, dealing @Damage[3d4[spirit]|traits:holy] damage to it. This damage has the holy trait.
Bubbling Pile of Orts.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The Hellknight commands the orts, and the trap lashes out at each enemy creature in its space and adjacent, dealing @Damage[(1d10+6)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save) If no enemy is in reach, an ort emerges in an adjacent square.
Bubbling Pile of Orts.name: Bubbling Pile of Orts

Captain Conziva.description:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.description: Captain Conziva Strikes with her naval pike. If this Strike hits, the captain can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a claw Strike against the target without increasing her multiple attack penalty until after the claw Strike.
0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.name: Pike and Strike

u6QEft9DxfittKI2.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Captain Conziva orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the captain's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}
u6QEft9DxfittKI2.name: Captain's Command

Captain Conziva.name: Captain Conziva

Omm2X9U53sWtJwUK.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The diabolic messenger draws a weapon and then Strikes with it The target of the Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.
Omm2X9U53sWtJwUK.name: Hidden Blade

RwOdkAEAFzEFKY17.description: The diabolic messenger deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Dragged to the Briny Depths.description: A giant squid rams the ship from below, using its beak to puncture the hull. It then wraps its tentacles around the mast, rocking the ship violently.
Dragged to the Briny Depths.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:23] to pull the tentacles from the mast, stopping the ship from rocking; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Dragged to the Briny Depths.hazardReset: The squid releases the ship for one round before regripping the mast and resetting the hazard The hazard no longer resets once the PCs defeat the naiads or they flee
Dragged to the Briny Depths.hazardRoutine: (two actions) On its initiative, the squid uses its first action to pull on the mast Every creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save On a failure, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} If a creature is prone when attempting the save, it slides 10 feet in a direction determined by the GM on a failure If this movement would force a creature off the ship, it can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} The squid uses its second action to make one tentacle attack
Dragged to the Briny Depths.name: Dragged to the Briny Depths

Dragged to the Depths.description: A giant squid rams the ship from below, using its beak to puncture the hull. It then wraps its tentacles around the mast, rocking the ship violently.
Dragged to the Depths.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:20] to pull the tentacles from the mast, stopping the ship from rocking; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Dragged to the Depths.hazardReset: The squid releases the ship for one round before regripping the mast and resetting the hazard The hazard no longer resets once the PCs defeat the naiads or they flee
Dragged to the Depths.hazardRoutine: (two actions) On its initiative, the squid uses its first action to pull on the mast Every creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save On a failure, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} If a creature is prone when attempting the save, it slides 10 feet in a direction determined by the GM on a failure If this movement would force a creature off the ship, it can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} The squid uses its second action to make one tentacle attack
Dragged to the Depths.name: Dragged to the Depths

Enraged Sea Life.description: A swarm of aggressive cuttlefish, octopuses, devil rays, and countless other species of sea life bite and bludgeon Timonithaea's enemies.
Enraged Sea Life.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to remove the crown from the altar while avoiding being bitten by the swarming sea life; or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 23) to disable the crown's enchantment, breaking Timonithaea's control over the sea creatures.
Enraged Sea Life.hazardRoutine: (one action) The sea creatures attack, dealing @Damage[(1d8+3)[bludgeoning],(1d8+3)[piercing]] damage to each creature hostile to Timonithaea within the temple (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).
Enraged Sea Life.name: Enraged Sea Life

Frenzied Sea Life.description: A swarm of aggressive cuttlefish, octopuses, devil rays, and countless other species of sea life bite and bludgeon Timonithaea's enemies.
Frenzied Sea Life.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] (trained) to remove the crown from the altar while avoiding being bitten by the swarming sea life, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 27) to disable the crown's enchantment, breaking Timonithaea's control over the sea creatures.
Frenzied Sea Life.hazardRoutine: (one action) The sea creatures attack, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[bludgeoning],(1d10+4)[piercing]] damage to each creature hostile to Timonithaea within the temple (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).
Frenzied Sea Life.name: Frenzied Sea Life

Goblin Rigger.description:
The theoretical leaders of goblin raids are called goblin commandos. In practice, goblin commandos rarely continue to lead their comrades once a battle has begun. Most shirk their responsibilities in favor of wading into the fray and claiming more glory from their tribe-mates.

These small humanoids typically have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, many are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

HhMYhB7AGitnowoU.description: The goblin rigger swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the rigger boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.
HhMYhB7AGitnowoU.name: Boarding Action

YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to the rigger

Effect The goblin rigger Steps.
YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.name: Goblin Scuttle

Goblin Rigger.name: Goblin Rigger

Imp Minion.description: Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.
Imp Minion.name: Imp Minion

Imp Minion (3-4).description: Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.
Imp Minion (3-4).name: Imp Minion (3-4)

In a Pickle.description: A soot-blackened brazier glows with fiendish light, shadows fickering inside.
In a Pickle.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] while within 15 feet of the brazier to command it to stop, reducing its actions by 1 (or 2 on a critical success); @Check[thievery|dc:20] to fnd the hidden switch on the brazier that deactivates it; or 1st-rank spell, counteract DC 17, to dispel the shadow flames in one square, using any spell with the water or light traits.
In a Pickle.hazardReset: The flames cease 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area, but after 1 hour, a well of darkness fills the brazier and it is ready to trigger again.
In a Pickle.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The trap ignites shadowy flames in a @Template[line|distance:5]{5-foot square} within the area of the room A creature that moves into or ends its turn in this fire takes @Damage[(1d6+5)[fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic]) Increase the DC by 2 if the creature is in magical darkness (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic]).
In a Pickle.name: In a Pickle

In a Right Pickle.description: A soot-blackened brazier glows with fiendish light, shadows fickering inside.
In a Right Pickle.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:21], @Check[occultism|dc:21], or @Check[religion|dc:21] while within 15 feet of the brazier to command it to stop, reducing its actions by 1 (or 2 on a critical success); @Check[thievery|dc:23] to find the hidden switch on the brazier that deactivates it; or 1st-rank spell, counteract DC 20, to dispel the shadow flames in one square, using any spell with the water or light traits
In a Right Pickle.hazardReset: The flames cease 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area, but after 1 hour, a well of darkness fills the brazier and it is ready to trigger again.
In a Right Pickle.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The trap ignites shadowy flames in a @Template[line|distance:5]{5-foot square} within the area of the room. A creature that moves into or ends its turn in this fire takes @Damage[(2d6+5)[fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save). Increase the DC by 2 if the creature is in magical darkness (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic]).
In a Right Pickle.name: In a Right Pickle

King Pirate Gorilla.description:
Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters. A gorilla uses its fangs and powerful arms to bite and pummel trespassers with wild abandon.

While many apes exhibit peaceful or reclusive behavior, gorillas can be territorial, and the megaprimatus is especially aggressive and dangerous.

4PvDXumkGQD2NB4z.description: The pirate gorilla is used to taking orders on board the ship. It loses its immunity to linguistic efects, including appeals to surrender.
4PvDXumkGQD2NB4z.name: Well-Trained

7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.description:
The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save. While a creature is frightened by this ability, it is of-guard to the gorilla.

Critical Success No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unafected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.
7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.name: Frightening Display

AZc9w8btLS3tlJmK.description: The pirate gorilla swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.
AZc9w8btLS3tlJmK.name: Boarding Action

King Pirate Gorilla.name: King Pirate Gorilla

Murderous Crowd.description: Concerned citizens shout slogans about the dangers of dealing with Cheliax and throw bricks at Chelaxian sympathizers.
Murderous Crowd.hazardDisable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:27] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:27] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:25] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:30] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.
Murderous Crowd.hazardRoutine: (three actions) The unruly crowd uses an action to chant a Catchy Slogan if it is not already benefiting from the effect It uses Shake Confidence once per turn and uses its remaining actions for cobblestone Strikes.
Murderous Crowd.name: Murderous Crowd

Naiad Commander.description:
The captain is the ultimate authority on a vessel, responsible for the livelihood and well-being of everyone on the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

5iTqDt4fDSnYuJIg.description: The naiad commander makes two Strikes, one with their rapier and one with their main-gauche (in either order) If both Strikes hit, the naiad commander can attempt to [[/act disarm]] the target Their multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.
5iTqDt4fDSnYuJIg.name: Dual Disarm

FMRFRcuXn2QHFX2v.description: When the naiad commander rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead In addition, anytime they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
FMRFRcuXn2QHFX2v.name: Bravery

OjePIuXOLgAEb4RG.description:
The naiad commander orders their allies to fight without mercy All allied creatures of equal or lower level within 20 feet of the commander gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the naiad commander's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TjRZbd52qWPjTbNT]{Effect: No Quarter!}
OjePIuXOLgAEb4RG.name: No Quarter!

eqKIODGOehxhMYJ0.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals
eqKIODGOehxhMYJ0.name: Animal Empathy

Naiad Commander.name: Naiad Commander

Naiad Raider.description:
Criminal organizations are always happy to loan out money at exorbitant rates, and their legbreakers are always happy to collect.

In the underbelly of society, the lawless reign supreme.

0gE6l2oSZZRPjEyT.description: The naiad raider [[/act shove options=stampeding-shove]]{Shoves} a creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their Athletics check if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the Shove succeeds, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage (double damage on a critical success).
0gE6l2oSZZRPjEyT.name: Stampeding Shove

NxCV08g4DxVZ7Xkd.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
NxCV08g4DxVZ7Xkd.name: Animal Empathy

TAqfKW4mSmkiBuzO.description:
The naiad raider makes a maul Strike against an adjacent creature If it hits, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute As long as this clumsy condition lasts, the creature also takes a –5-foot penalty to its Speeds and has weakness 5 to the naiad raider's Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zOaP4yGwbFOszxeJ]{Effect: Break Legs!}
TAqfKW4mSmkiBuzO.name: Break Legs!

u3p3LeRECuD5PFwU.description: The naiad raider Strides twice If they end their movement within melee reach of an enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.
u3p3LeRECuD5PFwU.name: Rushing Strike

Naiad Raider.name: Naiad Raider

Naiad Ship Hunter.description:
Bounty hunters are constantly on the move, whether within city walls or the wilderness, trailing their fugitive quarries for capture... or disposal. Often relying on stealth or deception as much as martial skill, bounty hunters employ a vast array of talents to accomplish their goals and collect the hefty payout.

Whether they're hired to wage war, protect a caravan, or infiltrate an impenetrable fortress, there's ample work for mercenaries all over Golarion.

LvkfpNccs65oqyIV.description: The frst time the naiad ship hunter hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage.
LvkfpNccs65oqyIV.name: Precision Edge

bolEEyhGC8YjlLhQ.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
bolEEyhGC8YjlLhQ.name: Animal Empathy

mCWRIeeB6PFExTmR.description: The naiad ship hunter designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking or Gathering Information about, as their prey. The naiad ship hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey, to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey, and to Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} about the prey. This effect lasts until they use Hunt Prey again.
mCWRIeeB6PFExTmR.name: Hunt Prey

yEaUAKruElpCN6zI.description:
The naiad ship hunter and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus on initiative rolls if the opposing side includes their hunted prey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.m1Vd997DEVoOeaJu]{Effect: Posse's Edge}
yEaUAKruElpCN6zI.name: Posse's Edge

Naiad Ship Hunter.name: Naiad Ship Hunter

YJR1cTJmIvEqaAHc.description: Animal Empathy The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
YJR1cTJmIvEqaAHc.name: Animal Empathy

f0DDarr5MFdbqCMt.description:
Trigger An enemy Strikes the naiad warrior while they're underwater

Effect The naiad senses the movement of their enemy in the water and jerks back in time They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.
f0DDarr5MFdbqCMt.name: Underwater Awareness

xTj7OVv1uH9YPuEK.description: The naiad warrior moves up to twice their swim Speed downward.
xTj7OVv1uH9YPuEK.name: Dive

Naiad Water Defender.description:
Gang leaders direct cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs. The gang leader often appears alongside a bandit gang or other criminals.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.description: When the naiad water defender rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.
Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.name: Evasive Reflexes

PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.description: The naiad water defender Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon
PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.name: Quick Draw

Uqr6Lka2wLdjHCCz.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals
Uqr6Lka2wLdjHCCz.name: Animal Empathy

dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the naiad water defender's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the naiad water defender and one of the naiad water defender's allies.
dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.name: Gang Up

fp3XmyB0pcpjCBex.description:
Trigger The naiad water defender is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The naiad water defender gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
fp3XmyB0pcpjCBex.name: Nimble Dodge

j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.description: The naiad water defender deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.description: The naiad water defender isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.
kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.name: Deny Advantage

qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the naiad water defender.
qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.name: Surprise Attacker

wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.description:
Trigger The naiad water defender rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see the naiad water defender gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the naiad water defender's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}
wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.name: Brutal Rally

Naiad Water Defender.name: Naiad Water Defender

Naiad Water Guardian.description:
Believing the ends justify the means, the unsanctioned sheriff is unafraid to use others for their own gain, through bribes, manipulation, or force.

These lone wolves have an aura of mystery, bravado, and swagger.

20d8PebGz6J8zRAT.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
20d8PebGz6J8zRAT.name: Animal Empathy

CYx6PDHf6ppok3ro.description:
Requirements The naiad water guardian's last action this turn was a successful Strike against a creature within 30 feet

Effect The naiad yells a command at the creature they hit The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or spend the first action on its next turn doing as commanded (or all its actions on its next turn on a critical failure) The naiad can command a creature to approach them, release what its holding, or drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.
CYx6PDHf6ppok3ro.name: At My Command

Naiad Water Guardian.name: Naiad Water Guardian

W2x8jxg3NDKhQYZt.description:
Trigger An enemy creature within 15 feet rolls a saving throw

Effect Destroy one imp minion within 15 feet. The enemy rolls twice and takes the lower result on the saving throw.
W2x8jxg3NDKhQYZt.name: Sacrifice Minion

qoCESLhY3rQqeK0h.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Olinda conjures an imp minion within 20 feet, which can make a melee strike against an adjacent enemy.
qoCESLhY3rQqeK0h.name: Conjure Imp

W2x8jxg3NDKhQYZt.description:
Trigger An enemy creature within 15 feet rolls a saving throw

Effect Destroy one imp minion within 15 feet. The enemy rolls twice and takes the lower result on the saving throw.
W2x8jxg3NDKhQYZt.name: Sacrifice Minion

qoCESLhY3rQqeK0h.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Olinda conjures an imp minion within 20 feet, which can make a melee strike against an adjacent enemy.
qoCESLhY3rQqeK0h.name: Conjure Imp

Pile of Orts.description: A rift to Hell crackles with unstable energy from the broken summoning circle as a squirming mass of fiends struggles to emerge A blood mist projection of a Hellknight angrily commands them.
Pile of Orts.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:16], @Check[nature|dc:16], @Check[occultism|dc:16], or @Check[religion|dc:16] (2 actions) (trained) while within 15 feet to weaken the rift, dealing @Damage[2d4[spirit]|traits:holy] damage to it. This damage has the holy trait.
Pile of Orts.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The Hellknight commands the orts, and the trap lashes out at each enemy creature in its space and adjacent, dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save) If no enemy is in reach, an ort emerges in an adjacent square.
Pile of Orts.name: Pile of Orts

Pirate Goblin.description:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups—especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids typically have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, many are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

UKgAtRQoGjCLDLmT.description: A pirate goblin is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Climbing, can Climb with one hand occupied, and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} opponents even if both hands are occupied.
UKgAtRQoGjCLDLmT.name: Tailed Goblin

czwGWW73rkPW7vBg.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to the pirate goblin

Effect The pirate goblin Steps.
czwGWW73rkPW7vBg.name: Goblin Scuttle

iNVPjf6gB7TmqEM8.description: The pirate goblin swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.
iNVPjf6gB7TmqEM8.name: Boarding Action

Pirate Goblin.name: Pirate Goblin

Pirate Gorilla.description:
Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters. A gorilla uses its fangs and powerful arms to bite and pummel trespassers with wild abandon.

While many apes exhibit peaceful or reclusive behavior, gorillas can be territorial, and the megaprimatus is especially aggressive and dangerous.

4PvDXumkGQD2NB4z.description: The pirate gorilla is used to taking orders on board the ship. It loses its immunity to linguistic efects, including appeals to surrender.
4PvDXumkGQD2NB4z.name: Well-Trained

7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.description:
The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. While a creature is frightened by this ability, it is of-guard to the gorilla.

Critical Success No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unafected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.
7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.name: Frightening Display

AZc9w8btLS3tlJmK.description: The pirate gorilla swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.
AZc9w8btLS3tlJmK.name: Boarding Action

Pirate Gorilla.name: Pirate Gorilla

Rowdy Crowd.description: Concerned citizens shout slogans about the dangers of dealing with Cheliax and throw bricks at Chelaxian sympathizers.
Rowdy Crowd.hazardDisable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:22] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:20] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:24] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.
Rowdy Crowd.hazardRoutine: (three actions) The unruly crowd uses an action to chant a Catchy Slogan if it is not already benefiting from the effect It uses Shake Confidence once per turn and uses its remaining actions for cobblestone Strikes.
Rowdy Crowd.name: Rowdy Crowd

Timonithaea.description:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered around untouched lakes, massive rivers, or other collective bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of these powerful nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies, gather news, or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they're fierce—and quick to eliminate foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Nymph Queens

Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over entire regions of untouched wilderness, not just single trees or ponds. Every variety of nymph can have a queen. Naiad queens are among the most prominent, and more often interact with nearby mortals. Thus, some scholars refer to naiad queens as simply "nymphs."

Gm902B0XQR5W4eLu.description:
Timonithaea is tied to a body of water or area with a great deal of water features.

A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract any spell that would harm the environment (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} ritual), using her spell DC with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank druid spell she can cast.

When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.
Gm902B0XQR5W4eLu.name: Tied to the Land

P658sPuiyqAqTdkz.description:
If a target already affected by nymph's beauty fails its save, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, effectively blinding the creature until its vision is restored with sound body or a similar effect.

The naiad queen can Dismiss the effect.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target, who must attempt a save against her nymph's beauty aura (@Check[will|dc:23] save). If the creature fails and was already affected by the aura, it takes a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.
P658sPuiyqAqTdkz.name: Focus Beauty

Y44FxT7CY4R6SkdW.description:
30 feet @Check[will|dc:23] save.

A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and becomes stunned 1 each time it starts its turn within the aura for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see Timonithaea.
Y44FxT7CY4R6SkdW.name: Nymph's Beauty

YJMvSGcOCT86q7GC.description: Timonithaea channels magical energy into the Enoménos crown to telepathically communicate with creatures who are beneath the water within 20 miles of Naós tou Neroú.
YJMvSGcOCT86q7GC.name: Timonithaea's Calling

nS51JCooM2dV2JTC.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
nS51JCooM2dV2JTC.name: Animal Empathy

z1Wnid4gCPgKMoV8.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in any body of water in her domain, she regains @Damage[30[healing]]{30 Hit Points}.
z1Wnid4gCPgKMoV8.name: Water Healing

Timonithaea.name: Timonithaea

Unruly Crowd.hazardDisable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:20] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:20] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:18] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:22] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.

Violent Crowd.description: Concerned citizens shout slogans about the dangers of dealing with Cheliax and throw bricks at Chelaxian sympathizers.
Violent Crowd.hazardDisable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:25] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:23] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:28] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.
Violent Crowd.hazardRoutine: (three actions) The unruly crowd uses an action to chant a Catchy Slogan if it is not already benefiting from the effect It uses Shake Confidence once per turn and uses its remaining actions for cobblestone Strikes.
Violent Crowd.name: Violent Crowd
